text:
I notice when we create a child theme from a default HubSpot theme in the DM that there is no fields.json file created. But all of the documentation (and even the DM manual child theme creation process) points to or requires a cloned fields.json file.

*Will the child theme work as expected if we upload via CLI without the fields.json file?*
Oops thanks for spotting this - that documentation is out of date. You do not need to clone the fields.json file down if you do not plan on updating it. I'll get that documentation updated
What do you mean by the `DM manual child theme creation process` though?
whaaat!!!!??!! Thank you! Cloning the fields.json file has always been cumbersome

Ohh I see what you're saying - when you create a theme, add the `extends` line you still have the blank fields.json file. You can delete this that safely (I need to double check whether it's doable in the UI, but you can definitely do it via CLI, and if not I'll work to get that resolved)
Unfortunately it’s not doable in UI… but I’d rather use CLI anyways. Thanks <@UKHNRHVC7>!
No problem! Sorry for the confusion here
psa: when it comes to section context variables make sure you wrap the variables in {{ if they're not inside a json object.
